etymology.description: semantic: 田 ‘field’ + phonetic: 卯 (bronze); later phonetic: 丣 (small seal).
etymology.interpretation: Component 田 cues the semantic idea of a place/field, while the phonetic element supplies the pronunciation. Over time the script replaced the original phonetic 卯 with 丣 in small seal, but the semantic base and overall reading remained in the same sound family.

examples.chinese: 我们留在这里休息(我們留在這裡休息)。
examples.english: We will stay here to rest.

examples.chinese: 请把我的电话号码留着(請把我的電話號碼留著)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng bǎ wǒ de diànhuà hàomǎ liú zhe.

examples.chinese: 雨停了，但地上还留着水(雨停了，但地上還留著水)。
examples.pinyin: Yǔ tíng le, dàn dìshang hái liú zhe shuǐ.
examples.english: The rain has stopped, but water still remains on the ground.
